column4: any way to make gnome always open my windows the same size and same place?
That would be the job of the window manager and Metacity doesn't do it afaik
thanks jrib just gave me a link.
How did you get them all to open maximised? I would like to be able to do that.

if I close a window when it is maximized..it opens maximized...running gnome. Even the devilspy...while it will adjust the size of non-maxmized windows..will still not prevent a window from opening maximized if it was set that way when clsoed
Seems your complain is with devilspie. Maybe contact the devs or file a bug report?
i only tried devilspy today just a little while ago. This behaviour of all of my windows opening maximised is constant (that is if they were maxmized when I closed them)
Ah, ok, the apps are saving prefs I guess.
I was hoping gnome (or kde) had a setting to prevent that
ah possibly..dont know how to override that.
In gnome on Dapper, if I close an app that is max'ed, it opens normal later.
running edgy myself...if I do it with say the terminal..it opens regular..firefox always opens max
it has to be sans something...sans means without
they have the name wrong then
technically ubunut is without a font then:)
, l90bpm Please take this stuff to #ubuntu-offtopic
